spanishExample: Debemos estar en la ciudad ese mes.
englishTranslation: We must be in the city that month.
vocabIncluded: debemos:must, we must (Deber, present, 1st person plural)

spanishExample: Deben venir para acá, a este pueblo.
englishTranslation: They must come over here, to this town.
vocabIncluded: deben: must, they must (Deber, present, 3rd person plural)
para acá: over here/in this direction (idiom)

spanishExample: Deberás hacerle eso a la tierra.
englishTranslation: You’ll have to(Deber) do that to the earth.
vocabIncluded: a, used in a "redundant indirect object", e.g. le hice un favor a la chica
deberás: will have to/must, you will will have to/must (Deber, future, 2nd person)

spanishExample: Debería estar en mi cuarto y no en otro lado.
englishTranslation: I should be in my room and not in another place.

spanishExample: Deberían estar en la escuela ahora.
englishTranslation: They should be at the school right now.
vocabIncluded: deberían: should, they should (Deber, conditional, 3rd person plural)

englishTranslation: She had to(Deber imperfect) go over there.
vocabIncluded: debía: had to/must have, he/she/it had to/must have (Deber, imperfect, 3rd person)

englishTranslation: We should have(Deber imperfect) gone behind the hotel.
vocabIncluded: atrás: back/backwards (adverb often used with de)
debíamos: had to/must have, we had to/must have (Deber, imperfect, 1st person plural)
del: "of the" before a masculine noun

englishTranslation: They must have(Deber preterite) been with their people.
vocabIncluded: debieron: had to/must have, they had to/must have (Deber, preterite, 3rd person plural)

spanishExample: Debiste estar ahí, lejos del mundo.
englishTranslation: You should have(Deber preterite) been there, far from the world.
vocabIncluded: ahí: adverb meaning "there", especially when close to the speaker or listener
debiste: had to/must have, you had to/must have (Deber, preterite, 2nd person)
del: "of the" before a masculine noun
lejos: far (adverb often used with de)

spanishExample: La puerta del hospital debe estar cerca.
englishTranslation: The door to the hospital must be near.
vocabIncluded: cerca: near (adverb often used with de)
debe: must, he/she/it must (Deber, present, 3rd person)
del: "of the" before a masculine noun
debería: should, he/she/it should (Deber, conditional, 3rd person)

englishTranslation: I shouldn’t have(Deber preterite) gone backwards.
vocabIncluded: debí: had to/must have, I  had to/must have (Deber, preterite, 1st person)

spanishExample: Puede que no deba irse del país.
englishTranslation: It might be that she mustn’t leave the country.
vocabIncluded: deba: must, he/she/it must (Deber, subjunctive, 3rd person)
del: "of the" before a masculine noun

spanishExample: Quizás debas ir a otra parte.
englishTranslation: Maybe you must go to another place.

spanishExample: Quizás no debamos estar en la calle.
englishTranslation: Maybe we must not be in the street.
vocabIncluded: debamos: must, we must (Deber, subjunctive, 1st person plural)
